bebida.descripcion: Desperados is an Alsatian beer brewed by the French Brasserie Fischer group, a brewery based in Schiltigheim, just outside Strasbourg, France. The brand is part of the multinational Heineken. Desperados is a tequila-flavoured beer, with an alcoholic strength of 5.9

With an intense character, Alhambra Reserva 1925 is our reinterpretation of the Bohemian Pilsen style, brewed with 'Saaz', one of the most exclusive aromatic hop varieties, which gives our beer its characteristic floral aromas. A beer to enjoy life through the details.

Mahou is one of the most important Spanish brewing companies, founded in Madrid in 1890 as Hijos de Casimiro Mahou, an ice and beer brewery. The company soon stood out for the quality of its production in a country with a wine-growing tradition that accepted beer late, and during the 20th century it became one of the most important in the Spanish beer market.

Cruzcampo is a brand of beer created in Seville in 1904. In 1991 it was acquired by Guinness Brewing Worldwide and, since 2000, it has belonged to the Dutch brewing company Heineken International, through its subsidiary Heineken España S.A.

The mojito is Cuba's extraoficial king, as half of the world. As caipirinha, is one of the most popular cocktail of the world, especially in recent years, during which it has experienced a boom. Although, to tell the truth, it has been around for years, because it was invented during the time of the American dry law, when going to Cuba to drink alcohol was just another legal loophole. Since many used to drink a kind of mojito, but made with bourbon instead of rum, the locals came up with a new recipe.

The first Blue Hawaii was made by Harry Yee, the head bartender at the Hilton Hawaiian Village hotel in Waikiki. Yee had to create a blue-colored cocktail when a representative of a well-known distillery demanded a drink with that hue, as he was promoting Curaçao. Although the combination of ingredients has evolved, the Blue Hawaii maintains rum as the base drink and the classic umbrella as a garnish.

The Caipirinha is one of the most famous cocktails in the world, of Brazilian origin but very widespread everywhere in recent years. The main and basic ingredient is cachaça, the most popular distilled alcoholic beverage in Brazil. It is a spirit obtained from the distillation of sugar cane, and usually has an alcohol concentration of between 38% and 51%.

juego.descripcion: I'm sure you've often read the "so-and-so has dysentery" meme to recall MECC's (Minnesota Educational Computing Consortium) historic The Oregon Trail, a game that attempted to reflect 19th century life and hardship. The 1985 classic was a radical improvement on the 1971 text-based prototype, even though it may seem extremely early 1980s to us today. Needless to say, the saga was a success, selling in the millions.

juego.nombre: Street Fighter II: The World Warrior
juego.descripcion: It was a phenomenon in the early nineties, unleashing fighting game fever. Capcom hit the nail on the head with this sequel, leaving the 1987 classic in its infancy. It laid the foundation for modern versus games. One of the most copied games by far. And also one of the classics with the most revisions. A legend.

Gremlin Interactive adapted the HeroQuest board game quite faithfully to the world of videogames, despite simplifying certain aspects. It was a turn-based role-playing game where each roll was dictated by a die. Apart from being addictive, it enjoyed one of the best soundtracks of the time on Amiga 500 (with the exception of the Turrican II intro), composed by Barry Leitch.

The release of Final Fantasy IV in 1991 was very important for Squaresoft for several reasons, the most obvious being the leap to the Super Famicom, with its 16-bit power. It also saw the debut of Active Time Battle, the hallmark of the battles. And the JRPG was rounded off with a memorable story, one of the favourites of the series. In 2007 it enjoyed a 3D remake for Nintendo DS.

Another old-looking game, but revolutionary for its use of vector graphics, was Atari's legendary Battlezone. An arcade game that put us at the controls of a tank to take on other tanks from a first-person perspective. Beyond subsequent adaptations to consoles, the saga would be reinterpreted on several occasions, the most notable being its entry into Virtual Reality by Rebellion, debuting first on PS4 in 2016.

It is an arcade game for which the years seem to have not gone by because its "Pac-Man" formula is still valid today, despite the many attempts to revitalise its formula with great success. Because the classic is still going strong and is constantly being re-released.

I'm sure you've often read the "so-and-so has dysentery" meme to recall MECC's (Minnesota Educational Computing Consortium) historic The Oregon Trail, a game that attempted to reflect 19th century life and hardship. The 1985 classic was a radical improvement on the 1971 text-based prototype, even though it may seem extremely early 1980s to us today. Needless to say, the saga was a success, selling in the millions.
